name: Caribe Hilton San Juan

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights from November 18 to November 20, 2006 to go to my friend's wedding nearby. Upon arrival, I was upgraded to a double double room on the Executive floor with an ocean view even though I paid at an extremely discounted rate. The room was clean and beautifully decorated with an awesome view of the Atlantic ocean. The beds were oversized and extremely comfortable. They have internet access available in the room by ethernet. I also received free continental breakfast in the executive lounge which had croissants, breads, coffee, tea, juice, yogurt and cereals. I didn't eat in their restaurants based upon reading previous reviews from others and instead just walked to a Subway restaurant nearby during the first night since I arrived in the late afternoon and was tired. The employees were all friendly and overall I enjoyed my stay there. I would definitely go again.
reviews.title: Had a great stay!

reviews.text: We just returned from 2 separate nights stay at this hotel. A pre and post cruise stay. We hit these rooms on priceline for a great rate. We were treated as well as anybody there. A smile given gets a smile in return. We asked for a nonsmoking room with a king bed and an ocean view . Wow. very nice. The grounds here are the real treat . a private beach, fantasic pool , a very friendly staff. Take some time and explore the grounds and you will be surprised. This is a very pretty resort. I love the lobby. Our second night we were given a room in the newer Villas. a very nice room. We like the Starbucks.
reviews.title: What a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate a local restaurant on the reccomendation of the concierge. We walked the short distance accross the bridge to the Conando area. The warm nights were a welcome treat.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Caribe Hilton

reviews.text: I would stay at this hotel again and again. We loved every minute of our stay.
reviews.title: Very nice experience

likes.disliked: — the room was a bit run down

reviews.text: Our thanks to the Hilton
reviews.title: Fantastic Private Beach and Grounds, Bad Food, Fair Rooms

likes.liked: — The private beach, gym, tennis courts, pool

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.text: We received this hotel for 75.00 a night for our precruise stay from Feb. 22-25, 07. (we were not tacked on any extra charges, like resort fees.) We arrived at 3, our room was ready right at 4:00. Very nervous as both workers at the desk kept saying oh what a wonderful room you got!! I told my husband I think they were trying to convince us it was a great room before we saw it!!!
Well, It WAS a great room. We were in the Condado Villas. #7117. Kitchen, bath, king bed, beautiful big terrace with loungers and boy what a view!!! Thought maybe we would get a
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Caribe Hilton
show me the money
reviews.text: lousy room since got it so cheap--glad I was wrong. Very clean room, great maid service.
Only one problem, our safe wouldn't work, needed a new part, and Carlos fixed it right on the spot!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Nice, over priced.

likes.disliked: — Nothing within walking distance, must take a taxi.

reviews.text: Food is high priced, but the day we were on the beach, my husband and I split a hamburg and fries. They were huge so we had plenty.
reviews.title: Screaming Kids, High Prices, Poor Service & Dirty Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a great deal from JetBlue inc this hotel. It was a great location not to far from SJU and very close to Old San Juan anf the sights! - Great pool and pool bar. lazy hammocks and a perfect spot for morning coffee over looking the ocean. I will be back.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Can't beat this location with pool and private beach. The lobby and restaurants (Mortons) were fine, but rooms and conference facilities in need of a facelift. It also has a great exercise facility and nice tennis courts. But, with such a great location and outdoor space, I did not find the rooms to be that much of an issue. The Villas overlook an old fort and with windows open in the evening, you can hear the waves. The neighborhood has no local flavor or restaurants, so it's a cab to Old San Juan (or 45 min walk) or short walk to Condado. Our conference provided shuttles to convention center but you could do the walk in 20 min. They also provided a great venue for a party. Only glitch are the rooms - otherwise this is great place to stay. I'll return.
reviews.title: Great location and beach - needs a (small) facelift!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 1 night before a cruise. Our room was in the Garden Wing on the 8th floor. It had a balcony and a wonderful sea view. The room could have used a touch up or two on chipped paint but otherwise the room was very nice. The beds were great and everything was spotless.
reviews.title: Wish we had stayed longer

reviews.text: The hotel property was gorgeous. We had a great meal at the Asian restaurant - one of the best we've ever had. Breakfast was a bit expensive but the buffet had anything you could ever want. Service was a bit slow but servers were very polite and friendly.
reviews.title: Satisfactory hotel

reviews.text: The grounds were very spacious and beautifully landscaped. Everywhere felt very secure. The pools were wonderful and beach areas very nice. Lots of areas to relax and just watch the crashing waves. Separate swimming beach was calm.
reviews.title: Resort in San Juan
Very Nice!!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Carbie Hilton May23-26 2005. I found it to be very nice but far from everything. Taking cabs everywhere gets expensive so you are stuck eating all your meals in the hotel. Breakfast at the Palmeras was terrible and when I complained they didn't even offer a discount or take anything off the bill. Your better off getting a muffin at the Starbucks located in the lobby of the hotel and saving yourself $40.00 the Palmeras charges for breakfast! The room in the new tower was great (King Deluxe Plus) beautiful bathroom, great view from room 1767! The staff was helpful and quick to fix the clogged toilet in our room. I went to the Wyndam Condado Plaza for dinner and gambling one night and next time would probably stay there because it's in the middle of everything! Overall we had a good time but watch out for the prices and the pool bar, two frozen Mudslides were $19.00!!
First the check in took over an hour despite myself being a Hilton Gold Honros member.
reviews.title: Caribe Nightmare
Relaxing Stay at the Caribe Hilton
reviews.text: Second the room was dirty and had soiled underwear in the drawers.

reviews.title: Caribe is great for relaxation
reviews.text: There was a heavy MOLD growth in the room and ventilation system which was very overpowering and which made me and my family ill.

reviews.title: Satisfied
reviews.text: Third - upon check out I had a hard time to get a bell man and was forced to carry my own luggage - when I tried to use a push cart to carry my luggage the rest of the way a bell man became confrontational with me and tried to physcially pull the push cart from my hands,
With everyone saying how great the hotel is because of the people I guess I was there the night they were all off.
reviews.title: What a monster hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.text: They were bombarded when I arrived to check in but it still took them an hour to check in the 5 guests in front of me. This is totally unacceptable. It was so bad I write the hotel to complain to which I did receive an apology letter.
reviews.title: Good Conference Venue

reviews.text: Finding the room
reviews.title: People make the difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After I finally received my room key I was off to my room. Well little did I know the mumbled directions I was given by the front desk employee were worthless. It was something like go straight, turn right and you'll see a sign turn there and you room is ahead. That would have been sufficient if this place was huge. I ended up going back to the desk to get a map and I was not alone I saw at least 8 other people that were also lost trying to find their rooms.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing

reviews.text: Just came back from an all girls trip to Puerto Rico. We originally booked the Caribe Hilton with the expectations of a nice hotel. The lobby was beautiful but after seeing the room we quickly exited stage
reviews.title: Not worth the money!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: left. Definitely not worth the money!! We got the unrenovated side. There are a lot of options in Puerto Rico and if you are going to pay, you might as well get a nice option.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Disappointed
reviews.text: So we headed over to the Marriott. It was beautiful. The lobby was nice. The bell men were cute and the rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Our first room had some leakage problems and we were promptly relocated (with help) and given a $100 credit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After realizing all the taxi rides were going to cost a small fortune, we chose the bus. Only $.75 each way! The bus goes everywhere from Old San Juan to Isle Verde and even the airport.
reviews.title: Lovely stay in Puerto Rico

reviews.text: Old San Juan is nice and perfect for tourists. We found a little shack by the port that served the best Marlin pastelillos, the manager, Andres is really nice. We also caught the ferry over to the Bacardi plant for free drinks!!! The souvenir shops definitely weren’t as cheap as the Bahamas. The clubs were okay. Too many young people though. Senior Frogs has a great atmosphere but leaves something to be desired in the food department.
reviews.title: Mixed but OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton last March for 4 nights with another couple and we had a fantastic time. We were a bit sceptical reading all of the reviews but we would definetely return.
reviews.title: Caribe Hilton is Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel:
reviews.title: Timing is all

likes.liked: — the private beach (the only hotel with private beach in San Juan)
likes.disliked: — most of the restaurants are expensive, bland, and only so-so food; you can do better

reviews.text: The hotel is wonderful. It's located just a few minutes from the San Juan International airport. You wouldn't expect to see such a beautiful resort in the location but you'd be surprised. The open air lobby and and birds were such a nice touch. The lobby bar is quite trendy and a great place to end the evening. There are different areas to the hotel, execuitve and villas, and main area. We stayed in the Villas (not Villas at all), just a standard room which was quite small, but new and clean. Our view overlooked construction in the city but did not put a damper on the vacation at all.
reviews.title: Food Poisoning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool & beach:
reviews.title: Generic, Bland, Characterless - As Far from Puerto Rico as Possible!

likes.liked: — The beach is protected from big waves by an artificial reef
likes.disliked: — Bland and generic, with no local flavor or charm whatsoever

reviews.text: The pool area was great and nicely landscaped. The property is on it's own secluded beach. But if you are looking for tropical blue water and white sand don't look for it here. It's a man made beach much like a lagoon, reminded me lot of a lake in NH. But none the less we enjoyed it very much because I was already aware of this when we booked our trip.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort!

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I (both 26) stayed at this hotel for one night on July 31 before a cruise. When we booked the hotel in April we were worried because of reviews we saw here but we opted to stay here anyway and we were very happy we did. We arrived around 5pm and our room was not ready yet but we were able to check our bags and explore the grounds a bit and were given free drink coupons so we were not too bothered by our delay getting into our room. When the room was ready I was pleasently surprised that our particular room looked exactly like the pictures on the website and I honestly could not find one thing to complain about. The room and bathroom were clean, the AC worked great, the bed was very comfy, and we experienced no bad odors at all. We went to Old San Juan for dinner which was great but I cannot really comment on the quality/price of food at the hotel itself (I would highly recommend Buru though for great tapas in old san juan) The grounds were perfect. We quite enjoyed laying on a hammock on the beach late at night listening to the ocean while drinking mojitos! On Saturday we got up early and grabed coffee and a bite to eat at Starbucks which was in the lobby and then spent the morning on the beach which again was clean and perfect for getting some sun and having fun in the ocean. There are a few convienience type stores around the hotel as well as a Subway about a 3 minute walk away (a safe walk as well) Overall we were very impressed with this hotel and would have no problem recommending it to others to stay at before/after a cruise. However, I probably would not recommed it to business travelers who may not be taking in the outdoor ammenites that this hotel has to offer. The hotel did not really seem to have it's act together in terms of check-in but it didn't really bother us too much as we were on vacation and were not about to let a delay in getting to our room get us down. Also, families may want to beware because of the lack of affordable food near by.
reviews.title: Great place for before a cruise
The new Villas are awesome
reviews.text: My family and I stayed in a three room Villa July 25th to the 30th, 2005.

This is the only way to go for comfort, space and luxury. The Master bedroom has a King sized bed (very comfortable), flat screen tv, nice chase, balcony and a small table to review the magazines of things to do.
reviews.title: One of the nicer hotels in San Juan
lovely grounds
reviews.text: The Master bathroom was huge and had separate shower and large garden tub, double vanity.

The middle room has a good size kitchen with a full size range, microwave oven, coffee maker, double sink and a full size refrigerator. The family room/ dinning room area is quite spacious and the balcony overlooking the lagoon and the beach is the best of both worlds. The middle room also has a bathroom (with shower) for visiting a guest. My mother stayed in the third room which had two double beds in it, a large bathroom with shower and double vanity. Her room had the best balcony (corner room) great views. Plenty of room in this 3 room villa with 1528 sqft.
reviews.title: Nothing here folks, move on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like i said in the title, top marks all round for this Hotel. I got a very reasonably priced room with balcony looking over the private beach area and sea. The room itself was excellent, very clean, spacious and the bed was amazingly comfy. My wife and I stayed here when we came back from a cruise and the hotel delivered exactly what we were looking for which was a chill out couple of days before we returned back to Scotland. The hotels facilities are sensational, with a choice of relazing on its own private beach area (protected from the sea if its rough by a rock breaker) or by any one of three pool areas complete with pool bar and hot tubs. The staff were all very friendly and would go out of their way to help. We went to bio bay organised by the tours team who delivered a great trip for us. I like to try and give a balanced view but am struggling to come up with negatives - if i must and they are small points - there is no milk in the rooms just powdered cream which turns a black coffee into a very dark brown coffee (there is however a starbucks on site) and the hotel is a fair walk away from any of the bars and restaurants in Old San Juan. This isnt really a problem though as only a very short taxi ride away. If you are looking for a hotel before and after a cruise i would do what we did and maybe stay somewhere with OSJ on your doorstep (we stayed in Sheraton OSJ) and then Caribe Hilton after cruise for a continuation of the excellent service and relaxation after the cruise. If i was to pick between the Caribe and Sheraton i would certainly pick the Caribe.
reviews.title: top marks for the Caribe Hilton

reviews.text: I recently spent 11 days at the Caribe on business. On arrival at night and in the dark the place looked fantastic, but almost immediately I found the desk staff less than friendly. There appeared to be a problem with our room and there was a room change for a reason that I was never able to understand. When we found our room it was not what we expected and it took some time to sort out. We eventually had a room with balcony in the Condado lagoon villa part of the hotel which was good and reasonbly quiet. Colleagues in the main part of the hotel repoprted that they were less happy with their rooms and several had to change. There is no doudbt that the pool and beach facilities are excellent, however, the bars and restaurants are very expensive (for a brit anyway) and to top it all there was a substantial resort tax - whats all that about?? The Caribe is somewhat isolated and a good walk or pricey taxi ride are needed to get away from the hotel and into old san juan.
reviews.title: Hot and cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary, a good place for a few days to unwind after a longhaul flight provided you have a decent room and can afford to eat! Otherwise ther is the whole of Puerto Rico out there to explore and old san juan itself is far more interesting with a selection of boutique hotels.
reviews.title: Nice property....problems with other guests

reviews.text: We stayed at this property for two nights prior to a cruise. We had no problem checking in and our room was on the 8th floor with a great view. The room was recently updated and included comfortable furniture, a large shower, and a small balcony. The AC worked well. As others have mentioned, the walls are not well insulated against noise. The breakfast provided to Hhonors members was basic but acceptable. It could have been upgraded for a small charge.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: The grounds at this hotel are very nice. There's a large pool area, a nice (private beach), and an area with numerous palm trees with hammocks.
reviews.title: Not Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My g/f and I stayed together the night before a cruise. the Caribe is a Puerto Rico classic. Its beautiful, timeless, and a very pleasant site to see after hours of travel. Arrive during the day time. The rooms are well appointed. Lobby beautiful. And the pools; for the first time guest the Caribe's beachfront pools are quite a site to see.
reviews.title: Excellent service, room, and pools but food and bar tabs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately there was a downside. This hotel's bars and food are very expensive. We sat at a pool side bar and ordered two rounds of drinks for us and a couple of simple snack food items like a couple of sandwiches. for that alone our check was close to dinner for two at a higher end steak house back home.
reviews.title: Better than the Marriot AND Cheaper

reviews.text: Later that night we sat for an hour at best at the inner bar near the lobby relaxing and enjoying the music. After three rounds of drinks we had a $80.00 tab.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
a fun place to have a relaxation
reviews.text: I understand that hotel property restaurants and bars tend to run higher. But the Caribe's casual food and drink is very expensive and I'd watch your tab closely if you chose to wine and dine there.

If you are hungry grab a taxi over to old San Juan and experience the highly recommended dining choices there. Afterwards you can go to a nearby pub as well and relax and save a lot of money. The hotel taxi stand attendents can make good recommendations.
reviews.title: Great place to stay before a cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here is a QUICK recap:
reviews.title: Overall Satisfied, however bring your wallet !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives: Hotel Staff was great, food was good, rooms were clean and view was great. Breakfast buffet was great, however PRICEY.
reviews.title: Dirty

reviews.text: Negatives: EXPENSIVE, EXPENSIVE, EXPENSIVE. After recently traveling to Mexico and South Africa, I was amazed how expensive this place was. Puerto Rico itself was moderately priced, however this hotel was EXPENSIVE. My GF and I shared food at AsIan restaurant --appetizer, fried rice and pasta + 2 drinks each cost $100.
reviews.title: Spent a few hours before our flight

reviews.text: YES, foo-foo drinks were $12 each. Go to pool bar and drink coors light for $5 each.
reviews.title: Great Family Getaway
love it!
reviews.text: Location was OK. Although it was located In the middle of Old San Juan and Condado, you needed a taxi to get to either location.

reviews.title: Old is Gold
reviews.text: I agree with the review by Mommabean, if the rooms were updated, I would have given it a pure 5 star. The view from our room balcony on the 17th floor was phenomenal but the noise of the air conditioner blowing several floors under us took away from the experience of sitting out and enjoying the crashing waves. There was also no wireless connection in our room available and the rooms were like you stepped into the 70's minus the bathroom which was nice. Those are the only negative things that I will say about this place because the rest of the experience was purely perfect. The location on the sea shore outlet is amazing. The beach with the tide breakers is perfect for swimming and safe for the kids. They also rent out kayaks and other non motorized equipment including snorkelling and such. There is a scuba outfit on site which does shore dives which are average but good if you don't have time for a proper diving trip. The chairs are plenty and were never unavailable despite having a packed hotel (mostly taken up by conference attendees). The man putting up umbrellas depending on where you were sitting was very nice. There was also an adult lounge area by the ocean which we envied.

reviews.title: Great Stay! but the added fees hurt at checkout
reviews.text: Some of the pools were closed due to a poolside party we were having. But when open, the pools were great and not overly packed and no drunk people. Very child friendly. The food at the grill by the poolside was good not great. Breakfast buffet was plentiful and as expected but made things easier with kids.(kids below 5 ate free). There are three other restaurants on site which we didn't get to have it. There is a Starbucks on site which is a huge saviour.

reviews.title: Great place to relax
reviews.text: The checking process was very good. Checkout was a little longer but the staff was extremely friendly. Everyone from the bell hops to the the front staff to the maid, everyone was super nice and polite. At no point did you feel that you had to tip.

reviews.title: Beach before a cruise
reviews.text: The convenience of this hotel was great. It is close to old San Juan (about 30 min

reviews.title: Great resort & hotel. Excellent beach.
reviews.text: We had a great stay! Property is on the beach with several pools and hot tube. Short walk to San Juan or taxis for 10.00 each way. Other hotels are located along the "Hotel Strip" and this was a short walk away from the noise of a downtown. We were able to walk to the Casino across the bridge at night for some night life.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a room with a great view over looking the ocean and pool area. The room itself smelled damp and extremely musty. Even with the sliding door open to the balcony the smell stayed. The bathroom tub did not drain after one shower, we had 4" of standing water, the towel bar was hanging, our bed was not made as it should have been. We only had a bottom sheet and a bedspread - no top sheet or blankets. We called maintenance to fix the bathroom before 5 pm saying we would be out for dinner and if possible please fix while we were out. We came back at 8 and nothing was done. I had to call again and they came up within a half hour. They fixed the bathtub drain, the towel bar and remade the bed properly. Upon checking in the people at the front desk were great. Upon checking out early on Saturday the person at the front desk totally ignored me for at least 5 minutes - he should be fired. When I complained about the room all he said was "sorry to hear that". This hotel seems to spend a lot of time keeping up the outdoor area which is fantastic.
reviews.title: room problems, great pool and grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife stayed here from 03/12-03/17 (3 nights with points and 2 paid) @ the HHonors tower. We think the hotel was really good. Although the room price was high ($260/night), other hotels like the Embassy Suites in Isla Verde (much farther from Old San Juan, no private beach, etc) were around $240! Not worth the little difference.
reviews.title: Nice/Very well located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: The room was beautiful (huge bathroom), with a partial view of the bay. The staff is friendly and the pools are awesome. We didn't find a lot of kids screaming around, which I think is great. It's very close to Old San Juan (5 min ride). Nice hammock area by the beach.
reviews.title: mostly pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Yes, the beach is small but the hotel was not very crowded (even taking into account that was Spring Break), so there wasn't any problem to find a spot.
reviews.title: Food not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drinks are overpriced ($7 for a draft 8 oz beer!)
reviews.title: Nice big-city hotel
Loved the Caribe and hope to stay again!
reviews.text: My husband and I booked our room at the Caribe last minute after moving from an awful hotel in the Ocean Park area. We never wanted to leave!

reviews.title: Would Return Here!
reviews.text: The room was only $50 more/night and it was very much worth it. Note that there is a resort fee as well, but all hotels seem to be adding in these extra charges and taxes lately.

reviews.title: Great for Couples and Family!!
reviews.text: The private beach was fabulous and we were told by several locals it's considered to be the nicest beach in the area. You can choose from hammocks, lounge chairs and a cool floating deck. The beach is also great for snorkeling which my husband and I really enjoyed.

reviews.title: San Se Festival
reviews.text: The location is perfect too- just a short walk or bike ride (we rented bikes which was fun) to the heart of Old San Juan, or to the Condado and Ocean Park areas.

reviews.title: Nice overall but room maintenance was weak
reviews.text: Our room was great- comfy and clean with a balcony and large beautiful bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We followed up an AWFUL experience at the Hotel Normadie by checking into the Caribe next door. What a difference!
reviews.title: Sooo much better than the Normandie next door

likes.liked: — Nice rooms, good service, great amenities, great pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I normally don't like chain hotels on the beach, but it was an oasis of quiet and calm with great amenitites--including a Starbucks, which somehow really hit the spot. Even the hotel restaurants were good and the service was friendly.
reviews.title: Nice place, but very crowded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think if you want beach, stay further towards Isla Grande and if you want Old San Juan, stay closer to there, but the location is still good and it was a good experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property-but don't eat there

reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel for one night, before our return home. We had originally booked the room for our first night in Puerto Rico, but our flight from the US was delayed. We were told by Expedia that our booking was non transferrable/refundable, but the hotel was understanding of our situation, which was out of our hands, and agreed to change our booking at no cost to us. What a relief!
reviews.title: Stolen Wallet

reviews.text: The hotel was nice, but very crowded. We waited quite a while to check in, only to find out that our room was not ready as promised. We were upgraded to a villa, which was lovely. Our villa neighbors were very noisy. Upon our complaint to the front desk, someone was sent to calm them down immediately and we had no further problems. I would probably look for a smaller, less crowded hotel the next time I am in San Juan, but the Hilton is lovely if you don't mind a crowd.
reviews.title: Looks aren't everything

likes.liked: — Proximity to water, variety of things to do, large rooms

reviews.text: I have been travelling to San Juan on business 1-2 times each year for over two decades. I usually stay at the Hilton or the Marriott.
reviews.title: Still good but needs to refurbish rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over the past few years, I have stayed at the Hilton more often because it is more easily accessible by car than the Marriott. It also has much larger grounds which means it is never crowded. No problem finding a chair near one of the pools or along the beach front. Unlike the Marriott, the beach has a nice break water making it easier to swim.
reviews.title: Missed the mark

reviews.text: I like the restaurants more at the Marriott but usually eat off-site so this is not a factor for me.
reviews.title: A bit run down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did notice that the rooms, of late, are showing their age (unless you are a VIP Hilton card member and are assigned the executive tower which has very nice rooms). In contrast, the Marriott’s rooms are ‘newer’ and generally superior.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all, a good place to stay but they really need to do some upgrading if they want to remain a premiere destination.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there for only one night in one of the Lagoon Villa rooms. Very new and nice and comfortable. We had stayed at the Caribe Hilton about 6 years ago. Very much improved. Loved our short 24 hour stay but would do it again! Mortons in the hotel was good as well!
reviews.title: Surprisingly very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a great six night stay at the Caribe. Check-in was painless. We received a free upgrade. The room was nice and clean with a great view. Self parking at the garage across the street was easy.
reviews.title: A Great Stay At The Hilton

reviews.text: We only ate breakfast at the hotel. As previously noted in other reviews, it's pricey but expected. The food quality was great.
reviews.title: Fantastic Time!

reviews.text: The hotel is a five minute drive to Old San Juan. Eric, the day Concierge is a great resource. The pools and beach were great. The exercise room at the spa was nice.
reviews.title: Fantastic, cannot say enough good about it

likes.disliked: — Nothing-I honestly cannot give one bad think

reviews.text: Overall, a great visit. We'd definitley consider the Caribe for a future visit.
reviews.title: Our stay at the hilton was nice
Great location and amenities but a tired hotel
reviews.text: The location was fantastic (and beautiful) and the amenities were great (nice beach, pools, restaurants) but the hotel was poorly maintained. Chipped paint on the door frames, garbage remained in the can near the elevator for days, light bulbs remained burned out in the lobby bathroom. Disappointing for $350 per night.

reviews.title: Surprisingly Exceeded Expectations
reviews.text: The CARIBE HILTON, surprisingly, exceeded our expectations! Having read recent reviews, our expectations were quite low. We arrived quite late (11:30 p.m.) due to delays and expected a musty, moldy leftover room. We had a GREAT room!! We were put on the 8th floor of the main building; the room was VERY clean, comfortable and quite roomy! Super room with fluffy pillows, and NO MOLD (!!) & a lovely view of the lagoon, old fort, and city. Since we were starved, we ventured down to the bar in hopes of getting a few peanuts; we were greeted by a lovely young lady who suggested a club sandwich, hot wings, & salad to share with a cold, cold beer for my husband and a yummy pina colada for me. At midnight, this seemed like filet mignon; it was quite good. What a great relief! While the food at the hotel is pricey (you won't find MacDonald's prices, but what do you expect!! ), it was always good quality, no matter which restuarant. Our favorite was the Lemongrass restuarant; plan ahead & make a reservation. We loved eating on the terrace, enjoying flora, fauna, & the swans in the lagoon - especially at sunset! Even though we ate several times in Old San Juan (@ El Pescador (!), Marmelade, El Convento, Panzo, & Parrot Club) , we purposely wanted to eat 2 additional nights at the Lemongrass. A meal can be made from just the hors d'oeuvres. An excellent drink, not on the menu, is fresh mango juice with Chopin vodka, straight up. There were 3 different conventions last weekend, but they were not noisey (Boston Mutual, Psychiatrists, and a retail association). We saw very few children, and very few college students on vacation. The experience at the Caribe Hilton was very positive and enjoyable - The Caribe Hilton staff were very professional and pleasant. Their English is impeccable and they were mostly (see note below) exceedingly helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only criticism of the hotel lies with the Concierge service. If you are not already booked through a convention for reservations to local events/tours, then forget it. Whenever we tried to talk with them, neither my husband nor I, nor the other couple (who also stayed at the Caribe Hilton), could get the concierge to help us! We were given an "I don't know," or an "I can't help you" (and a look of 'don't bother me'). They obviously missed the training class for personalism & positive demeanor when dealing with guests. [Then WHO IS at the hotel to help individuals?] If the general manager of the hotel reads this review (not likely!), I would suggest that he/she fire ALL of them & start again with 2 different desks - ONE DESK for conventioneers, & the SECOND DESK for individuals & families. Fortunately, the four of us are seasoned & adventurous in making our own plans, even in broken Spanish.
reviews.title: Avoid until construction is done
Nice - but Nickel and Dimed
reviews.text: I would strongly recommend the Caribe Hilton - certainly try to book the 8th floor with a view of the fort and book ahead for a dinner reservation at the Lemongrass restuarant. It is well worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been to this hotel before and liked it in the past. As other reviewers have pointed out, the location is amazing, given the hotel's private beach and that it is much closer to old san Juan than similar beachfront hotels in Isla Verde. However, the Caribe Hilton is in the midst of constructing a new addition and it is VERY LOUD (from around 7 am to 6 pm). There are many hotel rooms that are affected by the noise. Being awoken by construction noise, being unable to use the patio, and not being able to take an afternoon nap all negatively affected my attempt to have a relaxing vacation at the Caribe Hilton.
reviews.title: Perfect Location Beautiful Spot

likes.disliked: — inconsistent mixed drinks... depended on who the bartender was

reviews.text: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 4 nights with two children (ages 2 and 6). Our 6 year old has several allergies (dust mites, peanuts, pollen) and often when we stay at hotels he gets congested. However, he had absolutley no problem at the Caribe Hilton. We did have issues with food since they cannot guarantee that the food be peanut free. This is normal for most hotels so we prepared ahead of time and brought food with us in our suitcase (bagels with cream cheese, canned goods, etc). I'm pretty creative with this since we travel a lot and we are dealing with this peanut allergy. We had to bring food with us because there is no grocery store nearby. There are two little stores but they only have junk food, nothing healthy.
reviews.title: Young kids with allergies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was great for adults and kids. There were 3 pools, gardesn with peacocks and geese, the hotel had baskets of dried bread to feed to the fish in the little garden stream, there was a playground for toddlers - 6 year olds, there were huge chess games and connect four games (all of this stuff for free), there were little crabs on the beach at night to catch, and hammocks (tons of them to swing in or just lie around), there was free pina colada tasting at 1pm. You cannot get bored at this hotel in 4 days. It is a huge hotel with stores and a coffee shop, etc. We spent the whole 4 days there with the kids are were not ready to leave. We had a fabulous time and will definitely go back there again. I should also say that we stayed 2 nights in Isla Verde at the Hamptom Suites. Although the hotel was clean, I would not recommend that area. The beach was very dirty and the whole area of Isla Verde looked really rundown. We wished we would have stayed the whole time at the Caribe Hilton. We tried to switch our hotels back but it would have been to expensive for us. Also, I attended a conference at the Condado Hotel (5 minutes walking distance away) and although it looked nice inside the beach/outdoors area is not as nice for kids. it is much smaller. The Hilton Caribe has tons of space outside for kids to run around. Also, we had a promotion where you pay 2 nights and get 2 nights free. So, it ran us about $625 total (including resort fee) for 4 nights in an ocean view room--villa suite.
reviews.title: Great private beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't wait to go back to this hotel! The pool and private beach were amazing! Staff was friendly and we never experienced any problems. We stayed in the main hotel, but there are rooms across the street, not sure if I'd like it as much if I were staying there. Many food choices!
reviews.title: Fantastic suite, perfect views, unforgettable honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Considering my in-laws stayed at the Carribe Hilton for their Honeymoon 30 years ago, continuing a tradition was a must. Upon arriving, we were informed that our room was upgraded to a suite. To this day, I don't know if my in-laws did that or it was the genorisity of the hotel due our honeymoon visit. Despite that, the room and reviews were specatacular as was the Asian restaurant. I would recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: Great location and fun amenities!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Caribe Hilton offers everything you could ask for in a Caribbean beach vacation resort. The room was comfortable and nicely decorated - not luxurious, but certainly nice enough. The food was plentiful, and service, for the most part, was very attentive and pleasant. The best part of the hotel, by far, are the amenities - the pool/beach area is FABULOUS! It's huge, and you can easily choose a different area to sit in each day of the week - be it at the large pool with many levels, the circular sun deck (definitely the spot to see-and-be-seen), or the long, sandy beach. The landscaping is gorgeous, and it really feels like a lush, tropical destination. The rock-climbing, inflatable "igloo" in the water provided tons of fun for adults and kids alike. I especially loved the parrots in the lobby - my husband had to pull me away from them each time we walked through the open-air lobby. The location is really well situated - a short walk to Condado, or a 10-minute taxi ride to Old San Juan. It couldn't have been more convenient for everything we wanted to see and do. We really had a fabulous time and have no complaints about this hotel!
reviews.title: Beautiful Place with Great Staff

reviews.text: I was very disappointed. I did a lot of research on properties in San Juan so that my family and I would have a great vacation. (husband, myself, and two kids 2 & 7). Despite the reviews I had read for months (thinking the people were overcritical) I booked it anyway. I had a rate of 230 per night but felt that with all the promises it was worth it. The lobby is beautiful and the Starbucks is good...the private beach was fine...
reviews.title: No thank you, Caribe Hilton

reviews.text: We arrived on the last flight into San Juan and arrived to the hotel about 11pm...we were not taken to the room until about midnight. It was an ordeal getting checked in and I was a HIlton Honors member. I had requested an upper level floor...I was given the Garden Terrace (if you get this...change it immediately). We had to take an elevator "down" to our room. People joked and asked if we were sleeping in the basement. The Garden Terrace is a decent hotel room with a dirty patio...with dirty cheap patio furniture...overlooking the facilities area with the exception of the plants/foliage that is place in front of the patio. There are walkways on the other side of your hedge.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds

reviews.text: I did not feel it was worth staying at the hotel in that room for 230 a night (along with the 5 dollar per person...including children...surcharge per day...that's an extra hundred dollars on the bill). I spent two hours on the internet (wifi was an extra 15 dollars a day) looking for something else...not an easy feat during spring break...but we found something great and I am pleased that I was given the room otherwise I probably wouldn't have been motivated to move.
reviews.title: Nice, Friendly

likes.liked: — The staff. They were all kind and friendly and offered great suggestions for eating etc...
likes.disliked: — The price of the food and beverages. It was much higher than other carribbean resorts.

reviews.text: If you want more choices for restaurants and shops...Isla Verde is better located.
reviews.title: We loved the Caribe Hilton!

likes.liked: — Huge room, beautiful views, comfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked in a double double Villa (supposedly an upgraded room) which we found very cramped. They add a small bar type sink, a second fridge and a microwave to the Villa but the bathroom and room itself is much smaller than the Tower double double rooms. We switched to the Tower because the room was small and the view was of a construction site next door. Tower room more spacious with a beautiful view, fridge, large closet and huge bathroom with walk in shower. I would have preferred two Queen beds instead of the two Double beds which were very small. The grounds are the best part of the hotel. They have a beautiful pool area, shaded area with palm trees and hammocks and their own lagoon with beach. A lot of the hotels say "ocean front" but have no beach access. We never had a problem finding a lounge chair no matter what time we got downstairs. The staff will even bring you an umbrella and put it in the ground for you (free of charge). The staff is friendly and helpful. The food is very expensive. We spent $100 for four of us for a breakfast buffett. After that we had the free Hilton Honors breakfast and ate elsewhere for all meals. The hotel is a short cab ride to the airport as well as Old San Juan. I'd stay there again, mostly because of the grounds and convenient location.
reviews.title: You pay for what you get......

likes.liked: — great suite with outdoor hot tub

reviews.title: Ritz prices for lacklustre service
reviews.text: I agree with the prior review. We also stayed in the Lagoon Villas at the recommendation of the hotel as we explained before hand we were a family and needed space. The rooms were NY boutique small. The prices are very high for what you get. We were quoted $265 a night but after taxes and valet parking fee it was closer to $399 a night. Plus we found out people at the same rate had breakfast included while we were charged $20 per person for the buffet. Add that in and you are well over $400 per night for what is a very crowded and understaffed mid range hotel. We had no movie service in our room the entire stay despite reporting it daily to the front desk and the malfunctioning electronic rooms keys were a common pain for everyone. All the restaurants on the property are expensive for the quality.

On the plus side the staff/people are friendly, it has a great location and its close to Old San Juan. The concierge desk is overworked but very useful and the free wireless network access at the in premises Starbux a bonus!
reviews.title: Nice!
A great concept, but is it worth the money?
reviews.text: I was a tiny bit apprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews, but my family and I were quite pleased with our experience. The room in the Hilton Honors Tower was lovely...comfortable beds, nice sheets, big TV...and the bathroom was exceptional, with a huge shower area nicely appointed. The staff was helpful in arranging a tour to El Yunque (don't miss it) and in making reservations, getting taxis, etc. The place was very crowded, though, which meant lines for everything: Starbuck's (10 minutes every morning at least), towels at the pool, drinks at the pool bar, etc...After a few days there we were relaxed enough not to care so much. The spa was nice and I had a massage one morning. I wish we had discovered the Olas health bar earlier, because the food there was very good and very reasonably priced, unlike the other hotel restaurants ($27 for a plate of spaghetti...pass.) We mostly ate our dinners out as there are numerous excellent restaurants nearby. One night we felt like walking after too much mofongo and ended up walking home from the Condado. It isn't far, and there is a pedestrian bridge over the water, but the 2 blocks nearest the Hilton are in a construction site, so not the most pleasant of walks. Hopefully that will be completed soon and everyone can save the $10 taxi fare for the approximately one mile trip. My only disappointment was that the pool water was really too cold to make using the swim-up bar appealing...oh and the other complaint I would make to the management is about the two hot tubs. First of all, they are not nearly warm enough, and second, although a sign clearly says no children are allowed in, it was not being enforced. I got in for a few minutes and then some little boys with scuba masks decided to look at everyone under water...the lifeguard did nothing about it. The last straw was when 2 tiny kids IN DIAPERS got in!! At very least, they ought to reserve one of them for adults only so we don't have to be ogled underwater or bathe in pee water.
Overall, we were happy with our vacation!
reviews.title: Caribe was great

reviews.text: We spent two nights at the start of a week in Puerto Rico in February, with two pre-teen children. It's a handsome place, nicely conceived and beautifully set--we wanted to be near Old San Juan. But for the prices at high season we would have expected better. The room, in the newest wing (Lagoon Villas) was attractive, but far too crowded for the price, and there was inadequate closet space for two people much less four. We wanted to eat at the chic Asian-fusion "Lemongrass" restaurant, set in one of the courtyards by our wing, but it was booked for a private party (a wedding reception), which went on and on very loudly, keeping us all up until (get this!) the cops shut it down way after midnight. The pools are lovely, and the beach is nice (for play, not for anything else); and we found all of the service very nice, if not always very efficient. I wouldn't have minded any of the problems had we not been paying enormous prices (as high as Disney World--where you get your money's worth).
reviews.title: Decent Hotel BUT THE SERVICE STINKS
A Big Disappointment
reviews.text: Our vacation began on June 28th thru July3, 2005 with my husband and 3 teenage daughters. I would have to say that I am not one to complain and I did however check all the reviews written before we set out on our vacation. I ignored the "less favorable reviews" knowing that there are some people out there that you will never be able to please. I SHOULD HAVE PAID ATTENTION! The hotel was not at all what you see in the pictures on the internet. This hotel was very run down and neglected. Let me say that there was a foul odor the whole time we were there. It did not take us long to figure out that there was 2 sewer waste disposal trucks outside of our tower that emptied out our waste from the hotel. They were there 24 hrs and the whole time we were there. If you would walk on that side of the hotel (garden tower) there was literaly feces on the ground where it had accidently fallen out of the hoses of the trucks. When it would rain there were buckets cathing the water from the ceilings in the lobbies. The first morning we were there the bellman was running after a mouse that was in the lobby and because he could not catch him with the bucket he was using, the bellmen decided to pound him to death in front of everyone with this bucket. There was a problem with the pool. The hotel was not a place for a family. The resturants were to expensive there and because of the hotel's location there were no places you could walk to and eat. The hallways were never vacummed the whole time we were there. Everytime we would walk out of the elevator on our floor the ashtray that had fallen over with trash remained on the floor for several days before anyone did anything about it. Someone left their food on a tray outside of their hotel room and it stayed there until the next day. We had (2) rooms. They were very neglected. The a/c did not work at all in one and then the other it was too cold and stayed that way. It was soo cold that there was condensation the whole time on the windows. The other room it was clammy and hot. Some of the electrical outlets did not work and the one in the bathroom was very loose. The one time I did try to use the hair dryer it blew a fuse and shut down the air conditioning system, TV. We would lose electricals off/on our floor/room the whole time we were there. The beach was a lot smaller than it appeared in the pictures. What you don't see in the photos is all the construction going on around the streets as well as in the hotel. I could go on, and on however I cannot believe a hotel that has suffered so much neglect could still be in business. The hotel's walls were filthy. To think that this was a Hilton. I wonder when was the last time anyone from the Hilton Corporation has inspected this hotel. I can understand how it would have been a beautiful hotel in it's day but not anymore.

Last week I visited the Caribe Hilton with my family for a conference and vaction. It was a pleasurable experience and one we will long remember fondly. The Hilton was a nice hotel with comfortable rooms and friendly staff. The food was good albeit a little pricey. We stayed in the Tower on the top floor which afforded us a magnificent view of San Juan and the beach below. Nice beach and pool. Beautiful pond area with peacocks and swans. The meeting rooms were excellent.
reviews.title: Business and Pleasure at the Caribe Hilton
Loved the Caribe Hilton, will return
reviews.text: My husband and 6 & 10 yr old sons arrived at the Caribe Hilton, had a quick and smooth check-in and went straight to the Atlantico Bar and Grill - very friendly and attentive staff, I left great tips everytime. Pool had a swim up bar w/jacuzzi, and music. Las Palmeras restaurant had great buffet breakfast (free w/my package), lunch and dinner (39.99 for seafood buffet and 50% off kids meals). The beach water was clear and calm, the staff was very accomodating. Nightime we spent walking on the beach, feeding the tropical fish at the dock, laying in the pool or hammock under the moonlight. The location of the hotel was perfect for sightseeing in Old San Juan, only 5 mins away by car. Obtaining directions to different cities was easy, with the Concierge desk's help, we traveled to Ponce (to visit family), Luquillo (El Yunque rainforest) and Fajardo (beach).
We will definitely return to El Caribe next year, but this time, with my entire family.
reviews.title: Outstanding family vacation

reviews.text: My husband, 15 month old son and I stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 3 days, June 15-18, and absolutely loved it!!! The beach was wonderful for a family, it is located in a private cove, so there aren't really any waves. The water is clear, I could still see my feet, even when the water was up to my neck. There are schools of fish that are visible, which is fun to see. There is an area of the beach filled with palm trees, where the hotel has set up hammocks. A great place to pull up a beach chair with a book and relax for a few hours. The pool is very nice, with separate areas. We never felt crowded on either the beach or in the pool. It is a very big area. There are 2 seperate play grounds, one suitable for toddlers, and one for the bigger kids. There are tennis courts, a basketball court and games provided by the hotel. They are also equipped to rent toys for kids to play with in the hotel rooms, for free. The list included "Playskool" and "Fisher Price" toys for babies, up to toys suitable for young teenagers. A nice option for families.
reviews.title: Great Location, Fabulous Pool Area

reviews.text: Be careful when considering staying here for your San Juan visit. As others have pointed out the Caribe is in an isolated location which to the hotel's favor leaves guests with only hotel property dining and drinking options along with and their very high prices.
reviews.title: The Villas: a far cry from your private lagoon

reviews.text: This visit I tried the newer "Villas". The king was a small room with a crampt bathroom. And with the Caribe having no nearby shops, eateries or really anything else the kitchen is pointless. Don't let the website advertising hype fool you: the Villas are just another building with different style rooms from the main hotel..
reviews.title: Great location for pre/post cruisers!

reviews.text: There are much better options in San Juan.
reviews.title: 1,000 rooms = 0 service

reviews.text: We stayed at the Caribe Hilton after our 7 day cruise with Carnival. The hotel had all the amenities a family needs including a Starbucks in the lobby. The pool area was a bit over crowded but the man made beach is perfect for watching your kids as they do water sports/activities. There's loads of things to do while at the hotel. For a cheap taxi ride you find yourself in the center of Old San Juan where you can shop, and dine at any number of restaurants or tourist shops.
reviews.title: Try someplace else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and the rooms were a nice size. Room service is way over priced. The bar restaurants near the pool have basic chicken fingers and fries; again over priced.
reviews.title: a little pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent one night here in January before our Caribbean Cruise. Check in was very efficient after a wait of 5 or so minutes. We booked through Hotwire and so were given a Garden View room. This hotel is well located on a beach with a beautiful pool and bar/lounge area.
reviews.title: One night in San Juan

reviews.text: Our room was clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Great gem in the heart of San Juan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Caribe Hilton offers the best of all worlds in the heart of San Juan-- a small, private beach right on the water and close proximity to Old San Juan. If you are looking for a total beach experience, this may not be the place for you (instead, look at the properties in Isla Verde), but if you are looking for a good mix of sun/sand and city, this is a great option. The rooms are clean and well-maintained, and the service was very good. The property offers alot of outdoor options, from tables on the terrace, a swim-up bar, hammocks in the shade, to a private beach with a protected swimming area.
reviews.title: Great Place to Unwind

reviews.text: I truely enjoyed my stay at the hotel during the Sebastain festival. I arrived at 1pm and it did take 3 hours for a room to become available but that did not matter because I enjoyed the hote'ls outdoor ameninties. Sleeping on a hammock while watching the waves crash against the shore let me know that I was on vacation. I did not get a deal on this hotel, it was one of the only hotels with availability during the 2nd week in January - busy because of the Sebastian Festival in Old San Juan, but it was a good value. Hotel is in close proximity to the airport and old san juan and the private beach and outdoor area is one of the best I have seen in San Juan. You must try their frozen Mango Mojito. Room service is available and the food is average. The room was spacious but the walls were thin, we could here the neighbors conversate as if there was a window connecting the two rooms.
reviews.title: Great location - on the beach

reviews.text: Good value staying there - has it's own beach. The restaurants could be better - but we had coffee each morning at the Starbucks on site. Staff was very helpful. The entrance to the hotel could be improved - the lobby was nice gave it a tropical feel. The conciegre was very helpful in suggesting restaurants.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay on the Beach!

reviews.text: If you are looking to just lay in the sun, then this place is great. They have plenty of chairs, towels and choices: a small strip of beach sand, several pool areas, and a breezy section overlooking the ocean. Everything in the resort is very convenient: they have several places to eat (expect to pay resort prices), a swim-up bar (again, resort prices!), a Starbucks, a center to check your email, etc. So for sunbathing and relaxing, this place is great. If your looking for a more cultural, ethnic trip then being out at the resort could be a bit of a hassle. For a real taste of San Juan, you need to get outside the resort and go into Old San Juan (about a 10 minute drive). There you find more of the food and flavor of the area. Cabbing back and forth can add up quickly, but driving there is even more expensive with valeting and city parking -- plus the driving there is a little crazy -- confusing and fast-paced -- even for this city driver!. And the potholes! I thought I bottomed out the rental car twice. The spa is fair -- my massage was good -- but my facial, pedicure and maincure were barely adequate -- but if you are a big spa-goer who is used to first rate spa treatments, I'd pass on this spa and spend your time relaxing in the sun.
reviews.title: For laying out, this place couldn't be more convenient, but...

likes.disliked: — the food was overpriced for what you got

reviews.title: Great place for families!
reviews.text: My husband and our four children ages 10-15 stayed here during spring break. The bay/beach area is perfect for children. There are no waves, since there is a break wall far out. The hotel offers snorkel equipment, kayaks and waterbikes. The area is calm and safe enough to let your kids use the equipment (all for a price) alone, as long as they can swim. The pool is beautiful with waterfall and swim up bar. There is also a hot tub. There is plenty of room on the beach, around the pool and in the hammock area to set up for your day. We stayed in the Villas and the rooms were roomy and the bathrooms recently remodeled (marble vanities, double sinks, sepate toilet area). There is also a separate pool and hot tub for the Villas which the kids went to only in the evening. The hotel food was average, but the beach/pool area more than made up for it. Service was excellent, rooms were cleaned everyday by 10:00am, and front desk, valet and bellhops were all polite, helpful and friendly! I would go back again in an instant!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Your stay at the Caribe all depends which room you stay in. I read the reviews fearing we were going to be put in a moldy/dirty room, so I called a week before and requested to stay in the Honors Tower. Thank goodness they followed up on our request. It was a very nice room. It had a flat screen, a nice balcony, an awesome frameless, tile shower and a very comfortable king bed. It seems the "garden rooms" aren't as nice and may need rennovation.
reviews.title: Perfect Location/Nice Place
Great Hotel!
reviews.text: The lobby is gorgeous. The pool area is beautiful. The beach is the only "private" beach on the island for a hotel. The Olas spa was excellent! I had a facial.
This hotel is a perfect location if you want to explore a bit. It is 12 minutes from the airport. It is 10 minutes from Old San Juan. 10 minutes from Condado and 15 minutes from Isla Verde.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Caribe Hilton

likes.liked: — Hotel complex located on small peninsula

reviews.title: Loved the Caribe Hilton
reviews.text: I am a few months late writing as I stayed at the Caribe Hilton the first week of February 2005. My sister accompanied me on a business trip, I usually stay at the Embassy Suites in Isla Verde when I travel to the island alone but I wanted her to get a feel of the area including the beach. I had not stayed at the Caribe Hilton for 10 years and they have made some nice improvements to the building and grounds. The open air lobby area leading the bar and beach is beautiful. The staff is friendly and will do their best to help you with whatever it is you need. The bar is overpriced but treat yourself to a drink at least once and enjoy the view and music. The hotel restaurants are very expensive. However, you can take public transportation or walk to Old San Juan where there are lots of places to eat at a more reasonable price. If you go into Old San Juan, try La Bombonera Restaurant at 259 San Francisco Street, it's an old luncheonette. Sit at the counter and order fresh squeezed orange juice and expresso. The prices are very reasonable and you can try some local food. The Condado bridge was being worked on when I was there but when it is open, it's a quick walk from the Hilton and is pedestrian friendly. There are many good restaurants on the Condado and on the streets behind it. Explore during the day.

Back to the hotel, if you pay an additional small fee to upgrade to the Executive level, you get a continental breakfast until 10:30 am along with snacks and drinks at 5:30 pm and cordials and dessert from 8 to 10pm. It's located on the 9th floor in the old section of the hotel. My room in the old section was comfortable and had been uggraded recently with new good quality mattresses, comforters and curtains. The only complaint was the air vent in the bathroom needed cleaning. The housekeeping staff was good. It helps to tip the maids. When I stay again, I will request a room in the tower as they are a little nicer. The work out area is clean and there is a small cafe next to it with a selection of healthy lunches and juice drinks more reasonably priced than the other places to eat at the hotel. The hotel beach area offers lounge chairs and hammocks and the pool is nice with a great view of the ocean.
reviews.title: Good hotel, bad location
Very nice Hotel - Definitely will return
reviews.text: Hotel parking is $20 per day. If you are staying for a few days,rent a car as it is very easy to drive around and there is so much to see on this beautiful island.

reviews.title: I liked it!!
reviews.text: Just got back from 5 days at the Caribe Hilton. First the good news -- 7 great restaurants, nice lobby and pools, a small beach behind a breakwall, so no waves and little kids can play in the ocean, very comfortable and clean standard rooms. The biggest problem with the Caribe Hilton is location. Getting around in San Juan is a huge headache and costly. The Hilton is neither in Old San Juan nor in Condado. It's in the middle, and there's nothing there but the Hilton and the Normandie hotel. It's a 30 minute walk (hot sun) to Condado and 45 minutes to Old San Juan. Tried to rent a bike ($7 an hour and a hassle). Tried to rent a scooter for all 5 days, but only option was $60 a day for 9 am to 6 pm (yes must be returned every evening!). Renting a Harley was $150 a day (but at least you could keep it for the whole stay)! Taxis won't use meters and gouge tourists $10-$20 no matter how close you go (that's $20-$40 if you return). Buses (fare: 25 cents)? Both times I tried the bus: stood at bus stops minimum of 45 minutes (including in front of Hilton). Forget it. So conceirge desk pushed renting a car ($30 a day -- bring your proof of insurance from home or you'll have to add $10 a day). Hilton adds $15 a night to park your car. But why get a car? There's not really anyplace to park in Condado and Old San Juan anyway, so having a car is a hassle not a help unless you're going outside San Juan entirely. And the traffic jams up incredibly in Old San Juan and Condado. So here's what I did: took a taxi to Walmart ($20), bought a simple, fully assembled bicycle and lock ($60), and used it for 5 days (total cost $16/day including taxi to Walmart). Then I gave it away to a stunned kid on my last day (with a note to his mom assuring her it was not stolen). Biking to Condado took 8 minutes; to Old San Juan 12 minutes. Nothing worse than getting to a place and not being able to get around at a reasonable cost. Next time I'll stay in Condado (though Hilton itself was nice -- just horrible location).

reviews.title: Great Stay
reviews.text: Having read many of the reviews about the Caribe Hilton, I was a bit concerned; I wasn't sure what to expect. What I found when I got there was very refresing and definitely worth the money.

we stayed for 2 nights pre cruise and couldn't have asked for anything more. the rooms in the hilton tower were great, fab bathrooms - huge shower! pool area was lovely, great for kids of all ages and on the other side of the path from the pool was the hotels private secure beach. food for lunch was very good and reasonably priced and at night we got a taxi from the front of the hotel who took us to the hard rock cafe in town. we arranged for him ( eddie) to pick us up, and he was right on time, and he also took us to the ship and picked us up on our return and dropped us at the airport.
reviews.title: great! kids loved it, we loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: all in all, a great experience!
reviews.title: Loved the Caribe Hilton!

likes.liked: — The stand-in shower with dual shower heads and the comfy king-size bed!
likes.disliked: — Internet access was not complimentary; there was a charge of $15/ 24 hours.

reviews.text: Puerto Rico is a beautiful place. The Caribe Hilton just added to the wonderful experience. When we arrived at the hotel, we were promptly greeted by a bevy of friendly employees in the most amazing open-air hotel lobby. We were checked in to our executive-level room in the main building and had no problems with the room. The room was nice and large, clean, and very comfortable. It had a king size bed with a white feather comforter and large over-stuffed pillows. The bathroom was great, with a marble tub/shower combo and sink. The view from the balcony was very nice, although not as impressive as the view from the new HHonors Tower suites. The private beach was not overly crowded and extremely beautiful. The service was great and very prompt on the beach. We were basically waited on hand-and-foot.
reviews.title: Overall good

likes.liked: — The pool, Lemongrass, brunch and swim-up bar
likes.disliked: — price, no patio in the room

reviews.text: The Hilton is also the only resort with a private beach and a fort located on the premises.
reviews.title: Nice stay
Great location, spotty room service
reviews.text: During the stay, we asked to be transferred to a new room in the HHonors Towers. (Nothing to do with the hotel, merely personal reasons.) The new room was even more impressive than the first. The bathroom was completely different, in that it had a large stand-in marble shower with dual shower heads. There were also double sinks. The room also featured a flat-screen TV and a large balcony overlooking the private beach.
Hilton Tower magnificent view, quiet, comfort, spacious shower
reviews.title: Unique place, Unique staff

reviews.text: Hotel Caribe Hilton has a rare 60ies atmosphere very much Fleming flavor that immediately make you feel in a James Bond movie, but with updates standards. The only private beach of San Juan coast, the best Pina Colada in the planet. Besides the good food of the restaurants, the many activities offered every day, from Yoga morning sessions to Pilates to Sand Castles, organized in a discreet way, the point that make the difference of this hotel is the way the client is served: a customized service. Their kindness is truly genuine, their care to satisfy their hosts is taken is a serious way and you can feel it.
reviews.title: Resort style accommodations in San Juan.

reviews.text: You recognize a great hotel from a big hotel not when things are going smooth, but when something go wrong. In my personal case I hurt myself in the beach and immediately the Security staff appears and took care of me with competence and kindness. They kept taking care of my little injury since the day I left. In this respect a special thanks to Mr Hector Merced. During our stay, my husband and I anytime we asked for help or info or the many request a client during a long stay (almost two weeks) may have Hilton Staff attend with prompt efficiency and friendly smile. Highly recommended: Hilton standard with a family care.
reviews.title: Keep demanding a decent room

reviews.text: I've grown up staying at the Caribe Hilton and each time it continues to improve. Family friendly. Clean grounds and hotel rooms. Friendly staff. Beautiful pool / beach area with hammocks too. Food is your average raised price menu (I suggest visiting Old San Juan for traditional dishes at better cost). Quick taxi to OSJ ($12) or Condado, you can also walk the distance. I really have nothing bad to say about this hotel.
reviews.title: Love it Love it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hilton need to speed up the renovation of this hotel and do something about lunches.
reviews.title: Caribe Hilton

description: The Caribe Hilton hotel, one of the most luxurious hotels in Puerto Rico, is set on an exclusive peninsula, made up of 17 acres of lush tropical gardens. This Puerto Rico Hilton is ideally situated between historic old San Juan and the exciting Condado area, offering a secluded beach, lavish accommodations and amenities tailored to families, couples and business travelers alike. This San Juan hotel is just a 15-minute drive from Luis Munoz Marin Airport and five minutes from San Juan's new Convention Center.
